meanings.definition: To regard or treat with disdain or scorn.
meanings.sent1: She contemned the rude behavior of her classmate.
meanings.sent2: The bully contemned the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent3: The cat contemned the new brand of food by turning up its nose.
meanings.sent4: His actions contemned the values his parents had taught him.
meanings.sent5: The teacher contemned cheating by giving a failing grade.

meanings.definition: To consider or deem unworthy or deserving of disapproval.
meanings.sent1: He contemned the proposal as unrealistic.
meanings.sent2: The committee contemned the idea of cutting down the old trees.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater contemned the vegetables on his plate.
meanings.sent4: Her decision contemned the efforts of the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The judge contemned the criminal's actions as unforgivable.
